spirit:register.spirit:name: cmn_bgcal_ctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: Bandgap calibration control register

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_bgcal_ctrl_14
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: Three cmn_ref_clk cycles are required after the start of the calibration process to clear this signal.

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_bgcal_ctrl_13
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: Due to the nature of the calibration process, it is not possible to determine if the analog responded or not for the lowest code of 5'b10001. The reason for this is, when sequencing to lower codes, the calibration function is looking for the analog response to transition from 1'b1 to 1'b0. If the lowest calibration code is the correct code, the analog will respond with 1'b1, and the algorithm can't sequence to a lower code to look for the transition from 1'b1 to 1'b0. Similarly, if the analog is not responding, it is not possible to sequence to a lower code to detect this. Therefore, even when the calibration function selects this calibration code as valid, this bit will be set.

spirit:register.spirit:name: cmn_bgcal_ovrd
spirit:register.spirit:description: Bandgap calibration override register

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_bgcal_ovrd_15
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: The value of this field must not be changed while the calibration function is running.

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_bgcal_ovrd_14
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: The value of this field must not be changed while the calibration function is running.

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_bgcal_ovrd_5_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: The value of this field must not be changed while the calibration function is running.

spirit:register.spirit:description: Bandgap calibration start register

spirit:register.spirit:name: cmn_bgcal_tune
spirit:register.spirit:description: Bandgap calibration tune register

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_bgcal_tune_5_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This value is a twos complement value, so the calibrated code can be increased or decreased.

spirit:register.spirit:name: cmn_bgcal_init_tmr
spirit:register.spirit:description: Bandgap calibration initialization timer register

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_bgcal_init_tmr_8_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This results in the minimum number of cmn_ref_clk clocks required to wait 5 uSec. Note: This should never be set to a value of less than 1.

spirit:register.spirit:name: cmn_bgcal_iter_tmr
spirit:register.spirit:description: Bandgap calibration iteration timer register

spirit:register.spirit:name: cmn_ibcal_ctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: External bias current calibration control register

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_ibcal_ctrl_15
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This signal is intended to be for diagnostics purposes only. This calibration process is automatically activated internally by the startup state machine. When using this bit, the user must wait until after the internally activated process completes.

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_ibcal_ctrl_14
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: Three cmn_ref_clk cycles are required after the start of the resistor calibration process to clear this signal.

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_ibcal_ctrl_13
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: Due to the nature of the calibration process, it is not possible to determine if the analog responded or not for the lowest code of 7'b00000. The reason for this is, when sequencing to lower codes, the calibration function is looking for the analog response to transition from 1'b1 to 1'b0. If the lowest calibration code is the correct code, the analog will respond with 1'b1, and the algorithm can't sequence to a lower code to look for the transition from 1'b1 to 1'b0. Similarly, if the analog is not responding, it is not possible to sequence to a lower code to detect this. Therefore, even when the calibration function selects this calibration code as valid, this bit will be set.

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_ibcal_ctrl_6_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note that the most significant bit is the calibration code sign bit, and is always 1'b0 in this application. Note: The reset value for this field is with the common calibration power island switched off. In cases where this power island is switched on, the reset value be 7'b0011111.

spirit:register.spirit:name: cmn_ibcal_ovrd
spirit:register.spirit:description: External bias current calibration override register

spirit:register.spirit:name: cmn_ibcal_start
spirit:register.spirit:description: External bias current calibration start register

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_ibcal_start_6_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note that the most significant bit is the calibration code sign bit, and is always 1'b0 in this application.

spirit:register.spirit:name: cmn_ibcal_tune
spirit:register.spirit:description: External bias current calibration tune register

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_ibcal_tune_6_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This value is a twos complement value, so the calibrated code can be increased or decreased.

spirit:register.spirit:name: cmn_ibcal_init_tmr
spirit:register.spirit:description: External bias current calibration initialization timer register

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_ibcal_init_tmr_6_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This field should never be set to a value of less than 1.

spirit:register.spirit:name: cmn_pll0_vcocal_ctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: PLL 0 VCO calibration control register

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_pll0_vcocal_ctrl_15
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This bit is intended to be for diagnostics purposes only. This calibration process is automatically activated internally by the PLL control state machine. When using this bit, the user must wait until after the internally activated process completes.

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_pll0_vcocal_ctrl_14
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This bit is not likely to be observed as being set after internal automatic calibration is complete, because the internally generated run signal will be driven inactive immediately after the done signal is activated, and therefore the internal done signal will be cleared.

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_pll0_vcocal_ctrl_7_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: The reset value for this field is with the PLL controller power island switched off. In cases where this power island is switched on, the reset value be 8'h28.

spirit:register.spirit:name: cmn_pll0_vcocal_start
spirit:register.spirit:description: PLL 0 VCO calibration start point register

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_pll0_vcocal_start_7_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note : This field must be set to a value that is always at least one step size away from the minimum and maximum calibration codes, and is a function of the step size specified in this register. For example, if the initial step size is 4, this value must be at least 4 greater than the minimum calibration code or 4 less than the maximum calibration code.

spirit:register.spirit:name: cmn_pll0_vcocal_tctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: PLL 0 VCO calibration timer control register

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_pll0_vcocal_tctrl_2_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This divider value must not be set to a value so large that not enough feedback clock edges are sampled to make a good decision. There is no good formula for calculating this constraint. The reduced reference period and expected number of feedback clock edges must be calculated and an analysis per- formed as to if enough edges are available in the reduced time.

spirit:register.spirit:name: cmn_pll0_vcocal_ovrd
spirit:register.spirit:description: PLL 0 VCO calibration override register

spirit:register.spirit:name: cmn_pll0_vcocal_init_tmr
spirit:register.spirit:description: PLL 0 VCO calibration initialization timer register

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_pll0_vcocal_init_tmr_13_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This results in the minimum number of cmn_ref_clk clocks required to wait 10 uSec.

spirit:register.spirit:name: cmn_pll0_vcocal_iter_tmr

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_pll1_vcocal_ctrl_15
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This bit is intended to be for diagnostics purposes only. This calibration process is automatically activated internally by the PLL control state machine. When using this bit, the user must wait until after the internally activated process completes.

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_pll1_vcocal_ctrl_14
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This bit is not likely to be observed as being set after internal automatic calibration is complete, because the internally generated run signal will be driven inactive immediately after the done signal is activated, and therefore the internal done signal will be cleared.

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_pll1_vcocal_ctrl_7_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: The reset value for this field is with the PLL controller power island switched off. In cases where this power island is switched on, the reset value be 8'h28.

spirit:register.spirit:name: cmn_pll1_vcocal_start
spirit:register.spirit:description: PLL 1 VCO calibration start point register

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_pll1_vcocal_start_14_12
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This field is intended to be for diagnostics purposes only.

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_pll1_vcocal_start_7_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note : This field must be set to a value that is always at least one step size away from the minimum and maximum calibration codes, and is a function of the step size specified in this register. For example, if the initial step size is 4, this value must be at least 4 greater than the minimum calibration code or 4 less than the maximum calibration code.

spirit:register.spirit:name: cmn_pll1_vcocal_tctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: PLL 1 VCO calibration timer control register

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_pll1_vcocal_tctrl_2_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This divider value must not be set to a value so large that not enough feedback clock edges are sampled to make a good decision. There is no good formula for calculating this constraint. The reduced reference period and expected number of feedback clock edges must be calculated and an analysis per- formed as to if enough edges are available in the reduced time.

spirit:register.spirit:name: cmn_txpucal_ctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: TX pull up resistor calibration control register

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_txpucal_ctrl_15
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This signal is intended to be for diagnostics purposes only. This calibration process is automatically activated internally by the startup state machine. When using this bit, the user must wait until after the internally activated process completes.

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_txpucal_ctrl_14
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: Three cmn_ref_clk cycles are required after the start of the resistor calibration process to clear this signal.

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_txpucal_ctrl_13
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: Due to the nature of the calibration process, it is not possible to determine if the analog responded or not for the lowest code of 6'b000000. The reason for this is, when sequencing to lower codes, the calibration function is looking for the analog response to transition from 1'b1 to 1'b0. If the lowest calibration code is the correct code, the analog will respond with 1'b1, and the algorithm can't sequence to a lower code to look for the transition from 1'b1 to 1'b0. Similarly, if the analog is not responding, it is not possible to sequence to a lower code to detect this. Therefore, even when the calibration function selects this calibration code as valid, this bit will be set.

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_txpucal_ctrl_5_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note that the most significant bit is the calibration code sign bit, and is always 1'b0 in this application. Note: The reset value for this field is with the common calibration power island switched off. In cases where this power island is switched on, the reset value be 6'b010000.

spirit:register.spirit:name: cmn_txpucal_ovrd
spirit:register.spirit:description: TX pull up resistor calibration override register

spirit:register.spirit:description: TX pull up resistor calibration start register

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_txpucal_start_5_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note that the most significant bit is the calibration code sign bit, and is always 1'b0 in this application.

spirit:register.spirit:description: TX pull up resistor calibration tune register

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_txpucal_tune_5_0

spirit:register.spirit:name: cmn_diag_tmpsns_filt_ctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: Common temperature sensor filter control register

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_diag_tmpsns_filt_ctrl_31
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This bit, along with the temperature sensor filter done bit in this register make up a fully asynchronous handshake. Once this bit is set to 1'b1, it must remain set to 1'b1 until the done bit is detected as being 1'b1. After this event, this bit can be set to 1'b0, and must not be changed again until the done bit is detected as being 1'b0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_diag_tmpsns_filt_ctrl_20_16
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: There are a total of 5 elements in the filter that are triggered. Therefore, the minimum value this field must be before seeing the first filter output is 5.

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_diag_tmpsns_filt_ctrl_13_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Temperature sensor filter trigger delay count

spirit:register.spirit:name: cmn_diag_tmpsns_filt_out
spirit:register.spirit:description: Common temperature sensor filter output register

spirit:field.spirit:name: cmn_diag_tmpsns_filt_out_15_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This field is only valid when the temperature sensor filter done bit in the Common temperature sensor filter control register register described register is active. When the run temperature sensor filter bit in that register is cleared, the contents of this register will be cleared.
